From: "gdibildox" <gdibildox@...>
Subject: Reactor Networks - CPU time
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=80351896
X-Yahoo-Profile: gdibildox
X-eGroups-Approved-By: dggoodwin <dgoodwin@...> via web; 13 May 2005 16:57:30 -0000

Hello, 
 
I need to build a large network of reactors but I am concerned about
the CPU 
time it takes to run a simple reactor network Cantera file.  When my
network 
consists of 20 reactors, the CPU time is 2.62 sec; when there are 40
reactors, 
the CPU time is 21.9 sec.... 60 reactors -> 65.56 sec.  
 
I intend to use Cantera for the modelling of reactive flows.  A CFD
software will 
call upon Cantera numerous times during a simulation... I also expect
to use 
many reactors, so the escalating CPU time is a problem. 
 
I am working in C, and have been using the following to build and
advance the 
network: 
---------------------------------------- 
Reactor r[numReact]; ... 
ReactorNet sim; 
	for (i = 0; i < numReact; i++){ 
	sim.addReactor(&r[i]); 
	}  ... 
sim.advance(tau); 
----------------------------------------- 
 
If the reactors are independent why does the time escalate so?
Shouldn't it be 
linear?  Is there a better way?  
 
Thanks, 
Gerard 
 
note- 
In my tests, the reactors are not connected to each other.  The
purpose of the 
"network" is so I can use sim.advance(tau) and have all of the
reactors evolve at 
once.
